title: Implement User Interface Improvement: Remove Card Hover Animation
description: The current application features a card hover animation that causes a slight movement or shift, which users find distracting. The desired outcome is to have static cards that do not shift on hover while maintaining hover color changes. This change aims to enhance user experience by providing a more stable interface. The implementation should ensure that the hover effect is visually appealing without causing any distractions. The change must be applied consistently across all card components in the application.
requirements: Remove the hover animation that causes card movement.
Maintain hover color changes for visual feedback.
Ensure that the change is applied to all card components throughout the application.
Test across various browsers to ensure consistent behavior.
acceptance_criteria: Cards remain stationary on hover.
No visual movement or shift occurs when hovering over cards.
Hover color changes are still visible.
All card components across the app reflect this change.
technical_notes: Update CSS styles to remove any transform or transition properties related to hover effects.
Conduct cross-browser testing to ensure consistent behavior.
Document the changes in the style guide for future reference.

title: Implement Click-to-Edit Profile Photo Feature
description: Users currently have to scroll down to the profile photo upload section to change their avatar. This feature aims to enhance user experience by allowing users to click directly on their avatar to edit it. The expected behavior is that clicking the avatar opens a file picker or upload modal, maintaining the existing upload functionality. This change should provide a clear visual indication that the avatar is clickable and should work seamlessly on both desktop and mobile devices.

Ensure existing upload functionality is maintained.
Provide a clear visual indication (e.g., cursor change, hover effect) that the avatar is clickable.
Ensure compatibility with both desktop and mobile interfaces.

The existing upload functionality remains unchanged.
Visual indication of clickability is present.
Functionality is tested and confirmed on both desktop and mobile devices.
technical_notes: Use JavaScript to handle the click event on the avatar.
Ensure that the file picker is compatible with various file types and sizes.
Test the feature across different devices and screen sizes.

title: Implement Profile Photo Removal Feature
description: Currently, users can only replace their profile photo but cannot remove it entirely. This feature will allow users to delete their profile photo without needing to upload a new one. The expected outcome is to provide a 'Remove Photo' button in the profile section, which, when clicked, prompts a confirmation dialog. After removal, the user's initials or a default avatar should be displayed. The implementation must ensure proper file cleanup and update the avatar display throughout the application.
requirements: Add a 'Remove Photo' button in the profile section.
Implement a confirmation dialog before the photo is removed.
Display user initials or a default avatar after removal.
Ensure that the avatar display is updated across the application.
Handle file cleanup properly to remove the photo from the server.

Confirmation dialog appears before photo removal.
After removal, user initials or default avatar is displayed.
Avatar display updates correctly across the application.
File cleanup is performed successfully.
technical_notes: Implement the removal functionality in the backend to handle file deletion.

Ensure that the feature is tested for edge cases, such as network failures during removal.

The implementation must avoid unnecessary scroll bars and ensure that all items are visible at once.

The goal is to ensure that users receive user-friendly error descriptions that help them understand and resolve the issues they encounter during the upload process.
